answers.text: Policies are unique identities recognized by AWS services. They are similar to IAM Users and can contain API keys and passwords.
Policies are groupings of IAM Users. They are a way to assign and manage similar permissions to a set of Users.
Policies are a collection of IAM Users. You can add or remove Users in a policy. Policies cannot belong to other policies.
Policies contain permissions and are attached to IAM identities. AWS evaluates policies to determine whether a request made by the carrier of the policy should be allowed or denied.
